text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Egypt and Lebanon sign 12 cooperation agreements in the economy, tourism, culture and judicial fields. Egyptian Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri says President Hosni Mubarak has called for the set-up of a joint Arab market to achieve development. Lebanese Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri says that there is no hope for peace unless Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu changes his stance.
- Report is presented to the consultative council to amend a law to prohibit the sale of cigarettes to anyone younger than 18 years old.

- United States Middle East peace mission starts today to the region. Foreign Minister Amr Moussa says that comprehensive peace requires that Israel withdraws from southern Lebanon, the Golan heights and Palestinian territories.
